definitions.definition: A blow; a punch; a striking against; the collision of one body against another; the stroke that touches anything.
Something very successful, such as a song, film, or video game, that receives widespread recognition and acclaim.
An attack on a location, person or people.
A collision of a projectile with the target.
A match found by searching a computer system or search engine
A measured visit to a web site, a request for a single file from a web server.
An approximately correct answer in a test set.
The complete play, when the batter reaches base without the benefit of a walk, error, or fielder’s choice.
definitions.example: The catcher got a hit to lead off the fifth.

definitions.definition: A dose of an illegal or addictive drug.
definitions.example: Where am I going to get my next hit?

definitions.definition: A premeditated murder done for criminal or political purposes.
A peculiarly apt expression or turn of thought; a phrase which hits the mark.
A move that throws one of the opponent's men back to the entering point.
A game won after the adversary has removed some of his men. It counts for less than a gammon.
(heading, physical) To strike.
To manage to touch (a target) in the right place.
To switch on.
definitions.example: Somebody's been here! Hit the lights!

definitions.definition: To briefly visit.
definitions.example: We hit the grocery store on the way to the park.

definitions.definition: To encounter an obstacle or other difficulty.
definitions.example: You'll hit some nasty thunderstorms if you descend too late.  We hit a lot of traffic coming back from the movies.

definitions.definition: (heading) To attain, to achieve.
To affect negatively.
definitions.example: The economy was hit by a recession.  The hurricane hit his fishing business hard.

definitions.definition: To attack.
(heading, games) To make a play.
To use; to connect to.
definitions.example: The external web servers hit DBSRV7, but the internal web server hits DBSRV3.

definitions.definition: To have sex with.
To inhale an amount of smoke from a narcotic substance, particularly marijuana.
Very successful.
definitions.example: The band played their hit song to the delight of the fans.

definitions.definition: It.
